answers.answer: Hi,The urinalysis that is routinely done, is it for evaluation of sugar in urine or for any other underlying disorders that are monitored in the urine?Upto 5 leucocytes (WBC) in urine are considered acceptable.Leucocytes in large numbers can be indicative of inflammation along the urinary tract or possible infection if accompanied by bacteria.The type of infection will determine further treatment.HbA1C reading of 7.4 indicates that your blood sugar levels have been inadequately controlled, at least in the past 3 months. You will need to meet your treating doctor to adjust the dose of the antidiabetic medications you are on.Natural remedies for a possible infection of the tract include drinking plenty of fluids ( in excess of 2000 ml, if there is no fluid restriction due to impaired kidney function), addition of citrus juices in the diet, and plenty of fresh vegetables.Do keep us posted on your doubts and progress.Regards

question: Last week urine was tested as uausl.  My age is 70 yrs.  Pure vegetrian.  No vices.  No tea or coffee.  No sex relations for the last 27 years.The test results show large leukocyte in the urine.What is the course of action I should take to prevent it and cure it as also any natural remedy for it.  I am otherwise a helthy person active.  My diabetes reading is  7.4, cholestrol  HDL is 0.94, cholestrol is 6.43Kindly guide me with your answerhare krishna maniottawa, canada76 woodgate waytel 613 843 8833  any time
title: leukocyte in urine sample
